data.title: VSCode Insiders has different task bar icons when open and closed
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.16.0-insider (e5ed356edb364d102c061fc3ef6634de0dd58e0d, 2017-08-25T09:24:13.877Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.15063

---

It seems that the [new icon](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/6607#issuecomment-324456824) has a lower-detail version that is used at smaller sizes (which makes a lot of sense, at 16x16 you can't make out details like the L-shape not being fully filled-in very well).

With small task bar icons, it looks like this:

![](http://i.imgur.com/E6Co3UJ.png)

The problem is that _starting_ VSCode Insiders leads to another icon being shown, so you have different icons for VSCode in the opened and closed state. This seems like a weird inconsistency and doesn't feel polished.

![](http://i.imgur.com/4l48kLA.png)

This inconsistency doesn't exist when using regular-sized taskbar icons.

data.title: "spawn ENAMETOOLONG" when searching in large workspaces
data.body:
- VSCode Version: code-oss-dev 1.16.0 (9066eedcf7597779e3a710bf997d0d9f8748d597)
- OS Version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.15063
---

I have a [rather large `.code-workspace` file](https://github.com/HaxeFlixel/flixel-demos/blob/dev/flixel-demos.code-workspace) with 81 sub-directories. When I try to use find in files in that workspace, it fails with a `spawn ENAMETOOLONG` error:

![](http://i.imgur.com/zJPhuUY.png)

---

Steps to reproduce:

1. Clone [this](https://github.com/HaxeFlixel/flixel-demos) repository.
1. Open [the workspace file](https://github.com/HaxeFlixel/flixel-demos/blob/dev/flixel-demos.code-workspace).
1. Try to search for anything.

data.title: Group Policies (GPO) support
data.body:
I need to pre-configure and force-configure settings in VSCode for a larger team. We need to make sure all of them are using the same settings or we end with a mess of tabs/spaces (2/4/8) just as one example.

Some other things that come in mind are:
- disable automatic update
- add required addons
- disable bad addons
- all settings that can be made in the json file.

If this is already possible and I just missed the documentation let me know, please.

data.title: MSI based Windows setup

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I need to install VS Code for our developers. They are not allowed to install software. As we are only using AD deployment this requires a proper MSI setup that installs _per machine_. In the installer I need to be able to disable automatic updates on machine level.

I have only seen a bad InnoSetup setup that cannot deployed via AD. Can you create a modern installer based on WiX toolkit, please? If you need help I may be able to help.

But it doesn't sync with VS code version.
Could Microsoft consider make this project support web-based development environments?

It'd be nice to have a link directly in the extension page.

3. Disable all extensions & open again, same.
4. Current permission is 755, tried 777 & still the same.

Dev tools:

data.title: suggest VS Code support copying feature from file type
data.body:
Such as, html file can use Emmet feature, css file can use Color Picker UI feature, js file can use auto complete, and some feature of extensions, but they only work on certain file type.
Suggest VS Code add config like this:
```json
"copying-feature": {
    "ejs": "html, js",
    "stylus": "css"
}
```
And then, ejs file can use all feature from html and js file, and stylus file can use all feature from css file.

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
tslint|eg2|0.17.0

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. In the terminal, execute `vim`.
2. Observe the text `settle:settle:` in the buffer.

This text can be edited as usual. Saving the file will result in `settle:settle:` being written to disk. Opening Vim to an existing file will prepend `settle:settle:` to the contents of that file.

![screenshot from 2017-08-26 13-48-16](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1572323/29737630-3bf0b00e-8a65-11e7-8fe4-286f20dd2db1.png)

data.title: VSCode 64bit Windows 10 starts multiple WMI Provider Host with high CPU usage
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.15.1 32 bit/64 bit
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro 64 bit

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Starts VS Code and open the integrated terminal (CTRL + `)
2. Run "git status"

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

I have noticed an unusual lag when working with the integration terminal (I have configured mine to Git for Windows, but experience the same with the default cmd setting).

`
"terminal.integrated.shell.windows": "C:\\Program Files\\Git\\bin\\bash.exe"
`

When I investigated further I notice that each time I press a key or executes a command, the WMI Host Provider service appears in the process list with high CPU usage.

Using ProcessExplorer I can see multiple instances of WMI Commandline Utility were fired via Code.exe and given my workstation is a single physical core with 2 logical cores, this appears to explain why the short burst of spike in CPU graph.

When I run the commands from a separate Git for Windows bash prompt this issue is not observed.

I have recorded an example of this event in gif and attached along with my VS Code version info.

If anyone can please advise a fix or workaround for this issue that would be much appreciated, thank you!

![vscode-about](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16523765/29737484-8eaf4e68-8a51-11e7-9c63-85e4ada02b3b.png)
![vscode-wmi-record](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16523765/29737485-8eb1abae-8a51-11e7-8cd5-dabd531cc70e.gif)

data.title: Another explorer.sortOrder option
data.body:
Firstly, I'd like to see the following...

1. .dotHiddenDirectoriesAndFiles
2. directories
3. files

(all alphabetical)

Currently the `mixed` `sortOrder` is the closest thing.  However, it mixes directories and files.  It is nice to have the directories grouped together.

I'm sure everyone has their own preferences when it comes to this and I've read a number of issue tickets around the sort ordering.  Maybe it's possible to come up with a list of `sortOrder` options that solve everyone's quirks.  Or maybe a more customizable option here would be better so that users can build the ordering to best fit their needs.

data.title: PHP snippets no longer work outside of <?php ?> tags
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.15.1
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.6

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create PHP snippet 
`"TEST": { "prefix": "TEST", "body": ["TEST"], "description": "TEST" }`
2. Open new file
3. Set language to PHP
4. Add `<?php `  to new file
5. Make sure cursor is after `<?php`
6. `Ctrl+Shift+P` --> **Insert Snippet** --> Type **TEST** & hit `Enter`
7. TEST appears in file
8. Move cursor to before `<?php` - repeat step 6
9. As you type **TEST** Code tells you "_There are no entries to pick from_"

I would expect PHP snippets to work anywhere on a .php file, not just inside the `<?php` `?>` tags OR that html (or some other language) snippets would be available outside the `<?php` `?>` tags (They do not)


Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Find In Files broken
data.body:
Find In Files behavior is not predictable. If I have multiple files open which I know contains the search term, not all matching files will be shown.

- VSCode Version: Code 1.15.1 (41abd21afdf7424c89319ee7cb0445cc6f376959, 2017-08-16T18:07:25.676Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT x64 6.1.7601
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
unique-lines|bib|1.0.0
xml|Dot|1.9.2
Ionide-fsharp|Ion|2.33.2
vscode-insertdatestring|jsy|2.1.0
csharp|ms-|1.12.1
PowerShell|ms-|1.4.1
vscode-sql-beautify|sen|0.0.4

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open multiple individual files which you know contains a search term.
2. Perform a Find In Files for the search term.
3. In my case, one matching file was displayed in the results.
4. Select the tab of another file - doesn't matter if this file matches or not.
5. Run the search again (hit Enter in the search field or use the Refresh icon)
6. This time multiple matching files are displayed.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes, except this time zero matches were found, then one, then two, depending on which file tab was selected.

data.title: TM_FILENAME can't be use with regex in snippets
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.15.1
- OS Version: Ubuntu 17.04

Can't use this regex in my snippet:
```
export default class ${TM_FILENAME/(\w+)\.js/\1/g}
```

It actually prints `${TM_FILENAME/(\w+)\.js/\1/g}`
